head.title: A Company's Program Led to a Career in Science

hedline.hl1: A Company's Program Led to a Career in Science

abstract.p: Renate T Ghannam letter on August 20 article notes son, who chose career in science, was one of first participants in Ciba-Geigy company's after-school work program for students (S)

block.p: Regarding the article ''Students Play Scientist at a Real Chemical Lab'' [Aug. 20], our son, Ameen, was one of the first participants in the program while he was a student at Ardsley High School. At that time the Ciba-Geigy company had offices in Ardsley and offered an after-school work program. Ameen worked there for two years. But he never thought of himself as playing scientist: he felt that he was doing serious work and was making a real contribution.

This experience inspired him to choose a career in science. At Colgate University he majored in chemistry and continued working each summer at Ciba-Geigy. Upon graduating, he was offered a permanent position. However, his mentor encouraged him to continue his studies.

Regarding the article ''Students Play Scientist at a Real Chemical Lab'' [Aug. 20], our son, Ameen, was one of the first participants in the program while he was a student at Ardsley High School. At that time the Ciba-Geigy company had offices in Ardsley and offered an after-school work program. Ameen worked there for two years. But he never thought of himself as playing scientist: he felt that he was doing serious work and was making a real contribution.

This experience inspired him to choose a career in science. At Colgate University he majored in chemistry and continued working each summer at Ciba-Geigy. Upon graduating, he was offered a permanent position. However, his mentor encouraged him to continue his studies.

Ameen received his Ph.D. in chemistry and for several years did research in the pharmaceutical industry. He is now employed at one of the largest pharmaceutical companies as a ''medical liaison.'' He loves his work and is proud that through his work he can make a difference in people's lives. Had it not been for the program at Ciba-Geigy I doubt that he would have chosen a career in science.
I am very pleased to read that Ciba is continuing with the program, and I hope that our son's success story will prove to them how important and successful their program is.
